pageContext.claim: “We send them hundreds of millions of dollars a year -- El Salvador, Honduras, and other places -- Guatemala -- hundreds of millions, but they don't help us, like so many nations.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has given substantial foreign aid to Central America over the last several years, but it has declined dramatically since Trump took office. All three countries were only allocated $88 million dollars in aid in 2018, down from a combined total of $499 million in 2016. The aid is intended to improve the economy and government functions in these countries, in the hopes that lives will improve for citizens and fewer will feel the need to flee.
